title: Watch Sentinel-2C launch live on the final Vega rocket
summary: The Copernicus Sentinel-2C satellite is ready for liftoff! Tune in to ESA WebTV on 4 September from 03:30 CEST to watch the satellite soar into space on the last Vega rocket to be launched from Europe’s Spaceport in Kourou, French Guiana. Sentinel-2C is scheduled to liftoff at 03:50 CEST.

title: Goodbye Hera: asteroid mission departs ESA test centre
summary: After a year of testing, ESA’s Hera asteroid mission for planetary defence is about to depart Europe and head towards its launch site in the USA. The Hera team looked on as the crated spacecraft – along with its twin miniature CubeSats and additional equipment – was driven away from ESA’s ESTEC Test Centre in Noordwijk, the Netherlands.

title: Thruster Issues Delay BepiColombo’s Mercury Arrival by 11 Months
summary: The European Space Agency has announced that persistent issues with the BepiColombo Mercury Transfer Module’s thrusters will delay its arrival around the closest planet to the Sun by 11 months. BepiColombo was launched aboard an Ariane 5 in October 2018. The mission consists of two complementary spacecraft: ESA’s Mercury Planetary Orbiter and Japan’s Mercury Magnetospheric […]

title: Fourth Mercury flyby begins BepiColombo’s new trajectory
summary: Teams from across ESA and industry have worked continuously over the past four months to overcome a glitch that prevented BepiColombo’s thrusters from operating at full power. The ESA/JAXA mission is still on track, with a new trajectory that will take it just 165 km from Mercury’s surface on Wednesday.

title: The Starliner spacecraft has started to emit strange noises
What’s Happening in Space Policy September 1-7, 2024
summary: Here is SpacePolicyOnline.com’s list of space policy events for the week of September 1-7, 2024 and any insight we can offer about them. The House and Senate are in recess […]

title: Falcon 9 Completes Second Return to Flight of 2024
summary: SpaceX’s Starlink 8-10 mission lifted off successfully at 3:43 AM EDT on the morning of August 31st, deploying 21 Starlink satellites into orbit. This mission represents the second return to flight for Falcon 9 this year, and a historic turnaround.

title: SpaceX resumes Falcon 9 launches after brief FAA grounding
summary: SpaceX resumed launches of its Falcon 9 rocket early Aug. 31 after the Federal Aviation Administration ended a brief grounding of the vehicle.

title: SpaceX launches 21 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 return to flight mission
summary: The mission was scheduled to launch less than an hour before a Starlink flight from Vandenberg Space Force Base. Liftoff happened at 3:43 a.m. EDT (0743 UTC).

title: SpaceX set a launch turnaround record with back-to-back, coast-to-coast Falcon 9 launches
summary: The mission is the first for SpaceX since a landing mishap caused it to lose its most flown Falcon 9 booster. Liftoff is set for 1:48 a.m. PDT (4:48 a.m. EDT, 0848 UTC).
